metadata.titleEn: Daily soil moisture and temprature in the edge of the Tibetan Plateau in 2018.7-2019.7
metadata.titleCn: 青藏高原边缘冻土区逐日土壤温湿度（2018.7-2019.9）
metadata.description: Soil temperature and moisture are valuable in agriculture, hydrology, meteorology. This daily soil moisture and temperature data set (2018.7-2019.7) is averaged from hourly measurement. Data observation site are located over Gaizi river basin in the Pamirs Plateau ,and HuangShuiHe river in the northeast Tibetan Plateau, the Yarlung zangbo river basin in the southern Tibetan Plateau.The instrument used are  ECH2O - EC5 and 5TM. GaiZi soil temperature is measured using TR129 probe. Data are collected from 21 measurement sites. The data set also includes site location, soil texture, environmental attribute data. The depths of the measurement are 10, 40, 80 and 120 cm below surface. This data can be used to verify land surface model.
metadata.descriptionCn: 土壤温湿度在农业、水文、气象等领域具有重要的应用价值。本数据集为2018.7月-2019.7月的逐日土壤温湿度数据。数据观测点位于帕米尔高原盖孜河流域、雅鲁藏布江流域和湟水河流域。此数据的观测仪器为ECH2O-EC5和5TM仪器观测。盖孜河流域的土壤温度有TR129探头观测。逐小时观测值经24小时平均获得逐日数据。共21个站点。观测深度为10、40、80、120厘米深。其中包括站点地理位置、土壤质地、环境特点等属性数据。本数据可用来验证陆面模型。
metadata.instructions: Data are saved in an excel file (Daily_Smoothed_SM_ST.xlsx). There are two sheets. The first is soil temperature (ST_daily), the second is soil moisture (SM_daily). Columns are stations and soil layers, raws are times. The first raw is the site and layer title, the first column is daily time series. Data meta file is in a word document named Site_info.docx.
metadata.instructionsCn: 数据以excel 文件（Daily_Smoothed_SM_ST.xlsx）存储，列为站点及观测深度，行为时间。第一行为站点名称及观测深度，第一列为时间序列。第一页为温度（sheet: ST_daily）第二页(sheet: SM_daily)。站点信息包含在word文档Site_info.docx。

background: Over the past decades, warming climate has resulted in the degradation of frozen soil manifested primarily by increasing ground temperature, decreasing seasonally frozen soil depth, increasing depth of active layer thickness, thinning permafrost layer, increasing fragmentation of permafrost soil, and disappearing of permafrost islands. Frozen soil degradation has exerted significant influences in ecosystem, climate, hydrology, sediment transport and infrastructure in the polar regions, the Tibetan Plateau (TP) and other cold regions. About 99% of the Tibetan Plateau (TP) is covered by frozen soils and degradation of frozen soils will certainly impact TP's ecosystems. Frozen soil usually underlies alpine ecosystem. Frozen soil degradation due to global warming affects alpine ecosystem. The degradation of frozen soil has affected alpine meadow and alpine steppe on the plateau. However, exactly how the degradation has affected alpine grassland is still a highly debated topic.
research objective: Here, we investigate decadal changes of frozen soils and net primary productivity (NPP, representing vegetation) in the degraded frozen soil zones and the TP during 1982–2014 and 2015–2100 using a dynamic vegetation model, historical records and the latest CMIP6 projections, as well as observation-based soil temperature thresholds. This study examines the frozen soil degradation and net primary productivity (NPP) of plants that is associated with the degradation in 1982–2014 and 2015–2100.
challenges: Clearly, contradictory findings from point based and large-scale studies do not help design effective ecosystem conservation policies on the TP. These recent studies only examined static soil types (e.g., permafrost vs. non-permafrost soils specifically) during their study periods and did not show how the entire biomass changed dynamically with permafrost soil degradation over the time.
methods: The Lunds-Postdam-Jena Dynamic Global Vegetation Model (LPJ) that has been widely applied globally was used in this study. The model spatial resolution was set at 0.25° in this study and there were 3,978 cells on the TP. The simulation time spanned from 1957 to 2020. The model was warmed up by running iteratively from 1957 to 1986 for 1,000 yr in order to achieve dynamic vegetation equilibrium following Cuo et al. (2016) and Sitch et al. (2003), and then the 1957 model state was used as the initial condition for the subsequent 1957–2020 simulation period.
dataset: Observed daily temperature and precipitation were from the China Meteorological Administration (CMA, http://data.cma.cn/), and were gridded onto the 0.25° model grid following the procedures described in Cuo et al. (2013) before being aggregated to monthly values. Two permafrost soil maps compiled by Ran and Li (2000) and Zou et al. (2017), respectively, were used to identify frozen soil zone and its changes on the TP. The map by Zou et al. (2017), at 0.01° spatial resolution, was based on soil temperature, soil moisture and bulk density observed during 2009–2014, as well as MODIS land surface temperature and a widely used model that calculates temperature at the top of permafrost. In total, observations from 125 boreholes and 199 soil pits during 2009–2014 on the plateau were used by Zou et al. (2017). In this study, we used the map by Ran and Li (2000) at 0.0083° spatial resolution and referred to it as RL1982 to represent the early 1980s’ conditions (Nan et al., 2002, also used measurements that were originally published in 1982).
findings: In 1982–2014, degraded permafrost soil zones were in the range of 316,975–455,402 km2, with mean annual NPP staying around 84.9 gCm−2 and annual NPP showing a significant reduction at −1.71 gCm−2/year due primarily to warming air. Seasonally frozen soil also degraded by 15,636 km2 in the southeast TP, with mean annual NPP staying around 620.0 gCm−2 and annual NPP showing a significant increase at 11.00 gCm−2/year. In the future, frozen soil continues to degrade and the degradation accelerates toward the end of the century such that only 2.7% of permafrost soil in 2014 is left by 2080–2100 under the shared socioeconomic pathway SSP5-8.5. Mean annual NPP in the permafrost soil degraded zones in 2015–2100 is about half of that for 1982–2014, with spatially mixed decrease and increase trends in the near-, mid-, and long-term periods. Over the seasonally frozen soil degraded zones and the entire TP, more positive than negative annual NPP changes are seen in 2015–2100, especially in the southeast of the TP, due to improved growing conditions and the expansion of primarily subtropical and temperate scrubland. The study finds that as permafrost soil degrades, alpine meadow and steppe NPP decreases significantly in 1982–2014. In the future, permafrost soil continues to degrade in line with increasing CO2 emission. However, NPP associated with the permafrost soil degradation shows little change in the future. On the other hand, although seasonally frozen soil degrades in both the historical and future periods, the associated NPP mostly increases in both periods across the plateau.
backgroundCn: 在过去几十年中，气候变暖导致冻土退化，主要表现为地面温度升高、季节性冻土深度减少、活层厚度增加、永冻层变薄、永冻土碎片化加剧以及永冻土岛屿消失。冻土退化对极地地区、青藏高原（TP）及其他寒冷地区的生态系统、气候、水文、沉积物运输和基础设施产生了显著影响。青藏高原约99%的地区被冻土覆盖，冻土的退化必然会影响青藏高原的生态系统。冻土通常位于高山生态系统之下。由于全球变暖导致的冻土退化影响了高山生态系统。冻土的退化已经影响了高原上的高山草甸和高山草原。然而，冻土退化究竟如何影响高山草原仍然是一个备受争议的话题。
research objectiveCn: 在这里，我们研究了1982年至2014年和2015年至2100年期间，冻土区和青藏高原（TP）冻土变化与净初级生产力（NPP，代表植被）的十年变化。我们使用了动态植被模型、历史记录和最新的CMIP6预测，以及基于观测的土壤温度阈值。本研究考察了1982年至2014年和2015年至2100年期间冻土退化与植物净初级生产力（NPP）之间的关系。
challengesCn: 显然，基于点的研究和大规模研究之间的矛盾发现并不有助于在永久冻土地区设计有效的生态系统保护政策。这些近期研究仅在其研究期间考察了静态土壤类型（例如，永久冻土与非永久冻土土壤），并未展示随着永久冻土土壤退化，整个生物量如何动态变化。
methodsCn: 本研究使用了广泛应用于全球的Lunds-Postdam-Jena动态全球植被模型（LPJ）。模型的空间分辨率设定为0.25°，在青藏高原上共有3,978个网格单元。模拟时间跨度为1957年至2020年。为了达到动态植被平衡，模型在1957年至1986年期间进行了1,000年的迭代预热，遵循Cuo等（2016）和Sitch等（2003）的研究，然后将1957年的模型状态作为后续1957年至2020年模拟期的初始条件。
datasetCn: 观测到的日温度和降水量来自中国气象局（CMA，http://data.cma.cn/），并按照Cuo等（2013）所述的程序进行网格化到0.25°模型网格，然后聚合为月值。使用Ran和Li（2000）以及Zou等（2017）编制的两幅冻土土壤图来识别青藏高原的冻土区及其变化。Zou等（2017）编制的地图，具有0.01°的空间分辨率，基于2009-2014年期间观测的土壤温度、土壤湿度和体积密度，以及MODIS地表温度和一种广泛使用的模型，该模型计算冻土顶部的温度。在2009-2014年期间，Zou等（2017）使用了来自青藏高原的125个钻孔和199个土壤坑的观测数据。在本研究中，我们使用Ran和Li（2000）编制的地图，空间分辨率为0.0083°，并将其称为RL1982，以代表1980年代初的条件（Nan等，2002年也使用了最初于1982年发布的测量数据）。
findingsCn: 在1982年至2014年期间，退化的永久冻土土壤区域范围为316,975至455,402平方公里，年均净初级生产力（NPP）保持在约84.9 gCm−2，年均NPP显示出显著减少，年均减少率为−1.71 gCm−2，主要由于气温升高。季节性冻土在东南青藏高原退化了15,636平方公里，年均NPP保持在约620.0 gCm−2，年均NPP显示出显著增加，年均增加率为11.00 gCm−2。未来，冻土继续退化，退化速度在世纪末加速，预计到2080年至2100年，仅剩下2014年2.7%的永久冻土。2015年至2100年间，退化的永久冻土区域年均NPP约为1982年至2014年的一半，近、中、远期的空间变化趋势呈现混合的减少和增加。对于季节性冻土退化区域和整个青藏高原，2015年至2100年间的年均NPP变化中，正向变化多于负向变化，尤其是在青藏高原东南部，主要由于生长条件改善和亚热带及温带灌木林的扩展。研究发现，随着永久冻土的退化，1982年至2014年间高山草甸和草原的NPP显著减少。未来，永久冻土继续退化，与CO2排放增加相一致。然而，与永久冻土退化相关的NPP在未来变化不大。另一方面，尽管季节性冻土在历史和未来时期均有退化，但在两个时期内与之相关的NPP大多增加。

background: Frozen soil properties and thermohydraulic processes are still not fully understood due to lack of in-situ measurements, especially in the high altitudes and high latitudes (HAHL). Sand and silt are the dominant soil particles and clay is less than 10% at the sites. Existing and widely used soil products underestimates (significantly overestimates) sand (clay) content on the TP which raises the uncertainty in the thermohydraulic parameters derived from these products. Diurnal soil moisture and temperature variations are seen only above 40 cm, but seasonal variations occur down to 120 cm due to the soil memory effect. Seasonally frozen soil and permafrost soil show different freezing and melting processes. Dry soil features greater soil temperature temporal variability and deeper maximum frozen depth than wet soil. Zero curtain occurs in both dry and wet soil, and displays high (low) frequency but short (long) duration at 10 (80) cm that vary spatially. Moisture depression exists in seasonally frozen soil and is determined by the initial soil moisture and temperature gradient strength. The strong thermohydraulic coupling existed in cold season collapses in warm season. Soil moisture exhibits higher spatiotemporal variability than soil temperature. Permafrost and seasonally frozen soils have complex thermohydraulic properties and they are widely distributed in the high altitudes and high latitudes (HAHL), accounting for about 22% and 51% of the land in the Northern Hemisphere, respectively. Since soil has up to a season-long memory of water and heat, soil heat and water conditions can be useful for sub-seasonal to seasonal climate forecasts. Soil moisture anomaly can induce feedbacks that influence precipitation processes over land in the monsoon region. High spatiotemporal-resolution in-situ measurements of soil temperature and moisture in the HAHL are the key to reveal soil thermohydraulic processes such as freezing and thawing and enhance our understanding of soil thermohydraulic theory which is critical for developing and improving the parameterization of the thermohydraulic process in numerical models. However, there are still significant challenges faced by researchers in the HAHL. One is the lack of proper understanding of physical processes. Another one is the large uncertainties in model parameterization for accurately simulating the dynamic freeze-thaw processes.
research objective: The objective of this study is two-fold: 1) to investigate the spatiotemporal characteristics of soil texture and thermohydraulic processes in the frozen soil on the TP; and 2) to understand the differences in soil moisture and temperature behavior under various climate conditions and the possible mechanisms behind the differences.
challenges: On the other hand, in the northeast region, only DT is examined and this is clearly not enough and more sites and more observations are needed to fully represent the spatial patterns of soil moisture and temperature there. Additional multi-year observations of soil moisture and temperature at deeper depths and higher-resolution layers (more levels) will certainly enable the robust and in-depth analyses of the soil thermohydraulic process on the TP.
methods: Based on hourly measurements at 10, 40, 80 and 120 cm depths at 21 sites in the west, south and northeast regions of the Tibetan Plateau (TP) during July 2018 - July 2019, we examined soil particles, spatiotemporal variations of soil thermohydraulic processes and their connections with environmental factors to reveal the heterogenous frozen soil properties on the TP. Soil samples were collected at all sites in four layers whenever possible to determine clay, silt and sand contents and soil texture using the USDA soil textural triangle diagram. The procedure was conducted in laboratory in the following steps: 1) drying soil samples in room temperature, 2) sieving soil samples through 2-mm-mesh sieves, 3) removing organic content by adding 30% H2O2 solution and carbonate by using 10% HCl solution, and 4) using the Malvern laser particle size analyzer (Mastersizer 3000) to determine the soil particle sizes.
dataset: Based on hourly measurements at 10, 40, 80 and 120 cm depths at 21 sites in the west, south and northeast regions of the Tibetan Plateau (TP) during July 2018 - July 2019. We obtained measured soil particle contents at various locations on the TP (referred to as MSST) including the 21 LC sites, as well as Haibei, Maqu, Zoige, Madoi, Beiluhe, Chalaping, Naqu and Ngari from Su et al. (2011, 2013), Dente et al. (2012), Van der Velde et al. (2012), Yang et al. (2013), Zeng et al. (2016), Pan et al. (2017), Fang et al. (2018), Luo et al. (2018a), Yi et al. (2018), and Dai et al. (2019) for a collective examination.
findings: These findings fill the knowledge gaps in the soil thermohydraulic processes in the HAHL, and improve the understanding of frozen soil properties and heat-water coupling processes in soil in the HAHL. The study will benefit the Earth system model development and improve the quality of soil temperature and moisture assimilation and remote sensing products in the HAHL.
backgroundCn: 冻土特性和热水力过程仍未完全理解，主要是由于缺乏原位测量，尤其是在高海拔和高纬度地区（HAHL）。沙子和粉土是主要的土壤颗粒，粘土含量低于10%。现有的广泛使用的土壤产品低估（显著高估）了高原地区的沙子（粘土）含量，这增加了从这些产品中推导出的热水力参数的不确定性。日变化的土壤湿度和温度仅在40厘米以上的深度可见，但季节性变化可延伸至120厘米，这是由于土壤记忆效应。季节性冻土和永久冻土在冻结和融化过程中表现出不同的特征。干燥土壤的温度时间变化性大于湿润土壤，并且最大冻结深度更深。零温度带在干湿土壤中均存在，并在10厘米（80厘米）处表现出高（低）频率但短（长）持续时间，且空间上存在差异。季节性冻土中存在湿度抑制，这由初始土壤湿度和温度梯度强度决定。寒冷季节中存在的强热水力耦合在温暖季节中崩溃。土壤湿度的时空变化性高于土壤温度。永久冻土和季节性冻土具有复杂的热水力特性，广泛分布于高海拔和高纬度地区（HAHL），分别占北半球陆地的约22%和51%。由于土壤对水和热有长达一个季节的记忆，土壤的热和水条件可以用于亚季节到季节的气候预测。土壤湿度异常可以引发反馈，影响季风区的降水过程。在HAHL进行高时空分辨率的土壤温度和湿度原位测量是揭示土壤热水力过程（如冻结和融化）的关键，并增强我们对土壤热水力理论的理解，这对开发和改进数值模型中热水力过程的参数化至关重要。然而，研究人员在HAHL仍面临重大挑战。其中之一是对物理过程缺乏适当的理解。另一个是模型参数化中的巨大不确定性，难以准确模拟动态的冻融过程。
research objectiveCn: 本研究的目标有两个：1）调查冻土中土壤质地和热水力过程的时空特征；2）了解在不同气候条件下土壤湿度和温度行为的差异及其背后的可能机制。
challengesCn: 另一方面，在东北地区，仅对DT进行了研究，这显然不够，需要更多的站点和更多的观测，以充分代表该地区土壤湿度和温度的空间模式。对土壤湿度和温度进行额外的多年观测，尤其是在更深的深度和更高分辨率的层次（更多层次），肯定会使对TP地区土壤热水力过程的深入分析变得更加可靠。
methodsCn: 根据2018年7月至2019年7月在西藏高原西部、南部和东北部21个地点的10、40、80和120厘米深度的小时测量数据，我们研究了土壤颗粒、土壤热水力过程的时空变化及其与环境因素的关系，以揭示高原上异质的冻土特性。土壤样本在所有地点尽可能分四层采集，以确定粘土、粉土和沙土含量，并使用美国农业部土壤质地三角图进行土壤质地分析。实验室的程序分为以下几个步骤：1）在室温下干燥土壤样本，2）通过2毫米筛网筛分土壤样本，3）使用30% H2O2溶液去除有机物，使用10% HCl溶液去除碳酸盐，4）使用Malvern激光粒度分析仪（Mastersizer 3000）测定土壤颗粒大小。
datasetCn: 根据2018年7月至2019年7月在西部、南部和东北部的青藏 Plateau (TP) 21个站点的10、40、80和120厘米深度的小时测量数据，我们获得了TP各个位置的土壤颗粒含量（称为MSST），包括21个LC站点，以及来自Su等（2011，2013）、Dente等（2012）、Van der Velde等（2012）、Yang等（2013）、Zeng等（2016）、Pan等（2017）、Fang等（2018）、Luo等（2018a）、Yi等（2018）和Dai等（2019）的Haibei、Maqu、Zoige、Madoi、Beiluhe、Chalaping、Naqu和Ngari的测量数据，以进行综合分析。
findingsCn: 这些发现填补了HAHL中土壤热水力过程的知识空白，增强了对HAHL中冻土特性和土壤热-水耦合过程的理解。该研究将有助于地球系统模型的发展，并提高HAHL中土壤温度和湿度同化及遥感产品的质量。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that provides insights into soil texture and thermohydraulic processes on the Tibetan Plateau?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据集的示例，该数据集提供有关青藏高原土壤质地和热水力过程的见解？
Example.AnswerEn: The dataset includes hourly measurements of soil temperature and moisture at 21 sites across the west, south, and northeast regions of the Tibetan Plateau, covering the period from July 2018 to July 2019. It involves collecting soil samples to determine clay, silt, and sand contents, and examines spatiotemporal variations in soil thermohydraulic processes.
Example.AnswerCn: 该数据集包括2018年7月至2019年7月期间，西部、南部和东北部的青藏高原21个地点的土壤温度和湿度的每小时测量。它涉及收集土壤样本以确定粘土、粉砂和沙子的含量，并研究土壤热水力过程的时空变化。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of soil thermohydraulic processes in frozen soil regions of the Tibetan Plateau?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 青藏高原冻土地区土壤热水力过程的特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: diurnal soil moisture and temperature variations above 40 cm, seasonal variations down to 120 cm, soil memory effect, differences between seasonally frozen soil and permafrost soil, greater temporal variability in temperature in dry soil, deeper maximum frozen depths in dry soil, zero curtain phenomena, moisture depression, influenced by initial soil moisture and temperature gradients
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 40厘米以上土壤水分和温度的昼夜变化，120厘米以下的季节性变化，土壤记忆效应，季节性冻土与永久冻土的差异，干燥土壤中温度的更大时间变异性，干燥土壤中更深的最大冻结深度，零幕现象，水分抑制，受初始土壤水分和温度梯度的影响。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原冻土的背景下，测定土壤质地时所测量的具体属性包括：土壤颗粒的大小分布（如砂、淤泥和粘土的比例）、土壤的密度、孔隙度、以及水分保持能力等。
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: clay content, silt content, sand content
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 粘土含量，粉砂含量，砂含量

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'soil thermohydraulic processes' mean in the context of frozen soil research on the Tibetan Plateau?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原的冻土研究中，“土壤热水力过程”指的是土壤中热量和水分的相互作用及其对冻土特性的影响。
Definition.AnswerEn: Soil thermohydraulic processes refer to the interactions and behaviors of soil temperature and moisture, including freezing and thawing processes, in frozen soil environments. These processes are influenced by soil texture, climate conditions, and the soil's ability to retain heat and moisture over time, which are critical for understanding the dynamics of frozen soil properties and the impact on ecosystems in high altitudes and high latitudes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 土壤热水力过程是指土壤温度和湿度之间的相互作用和行为，包括在冻土环境中的冻结和融化过程。这些过程受到土壤质地、气候条件以及土壤保持热量和湿度能力的影响，这些因素对于理解冻土特性的动态以及对高海拔和高纬度生态系统的影响至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'dynamic vegetation model' in assessing frozen soil degradation and its impact on net primary productivity?
Definition.QuestionCn: “动态植被模型”在评估冻土退化及其对净初级生产力影响方面具有重要意义。
Definition.AnswerEn: A dynamic vegetation model, such as the Lunds-Postdam-Jena Dynamic Global Vegetation Model (LPJ), simulates the interactions between vegetation and climate over time. In the context of frozen soil degradation, it helps assess changes in net primary productivity (NPP) by modeling how vegetation responds to environmental changes, including soil temperature and moisture variations, across different time periods and climate scenarios on the Tibetan Plateau.
Definition.AnswerCn: 动态植被模型，如伦敦-波茨坦-耶拿动态全球植被模型（LPJ），模拟了植被与气候之间的相互作用。在冻土退化的背景下，它有助于评估净初级生产力（NPP）的变化，通过模拟植被如何响应环境变化，包括土壤温度和湿度的变化，跨越不同的时间段和气候情景，特别是在青藏高原上。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'zero curtain' phenomenon signify in soil temperature analysis within frozen soil studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: “零幕现象”在冻土研究中的土壤温度分析中意味着什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'zero curtain' phenomenon refers to the period during which soil temperature remains near the freezing point despite ongoing heat exchange processes. It occurs in both dry and wet soil and is characterized by high frequency and short duration at shallower depths (e.g., 10 cm) and low frequency and long duration at deeper depths (e.g., 80 cm). This phenomenon is important for understanding the thermal properties of frozen soil and its implications for soil moisture and temperature dynamics.
Definition.AnswerCn: “零幕”现象指的是土壤温度在持续的热交换过程中仍然保持在冰点附近的时期。它发生在干燥和湿润的土壤中，特征是在较浅的深度（例如10厘米）频率高且持续时间短，而在较深的深度（例如80厘米）频率低且持续时间长。这个现象对于理解冻土的热特性及其对土壤水分和温度动态的影响非常重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the use of hourly measurements at multiple soil depths compare to other data collection methods in capturing soil thermohydraulic processes on the Tibetan Plateau?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在捕捉青藏高原土壤热水力过程方面，使用多个土壤深度的每小时测量与其他数据收集方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Hourly measurements at various depths (10, 40, 80, and 120 cm) allow for detailed spatiotemporal analysis of soil thermohydraulic processes, revealing heterogeneous frozen soil properties. This method provides high-resolution data that can uncover diurnal and seasonal variations not captured by less frequent sampling methods.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在不同深度（10、40、80 和 120 厘米）进行每小时测量，可以对土壤热水力过程进行详细的时空分析，揭示异质的冻土特性。这种方法提供了高分辨率的数据，可以揭示不被较少频率采样方法捕捉到的昼夜和季节变化。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges faced in simulating dynamic freeze-thaw processes differ from those encountered in static soil type studies on the Tibetan Plateau?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在模拟动态冻融过程时面临的挑战与在青藏高原进行静态土壤类型研究时遇到的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Simulating dynamic freeze-thaw processes is challenged by large uncertainties in model parameterization and a lack of understanding of physical processes, whereas static soil type studies are limited by their inability to show dynamic changes in biomass and permafrost soil degradation. Both require more extensive data collection for improved accuracy.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 模拟动态冻融过程面临着模型参数化的大量不确定性和对物理过程理解的不足，而静态土壤类型研究则因无法显示生物量和永冻土土壤退化的动态变化而受到限制。两者都需要更广泛的数据收集以提高准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What underlying factors can be inferred from the spatial and temporal variations in soil temperature and moisture data at different depths in frozen soil areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在冻土地区，不同深度的土壤温度和湿度数据的空间和时间变化可以推断出哪些潜在因素？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The variations in soil temperature and moisture at different depths suggest complex thermohydraulic properties of frozen soils, influenced by soil texture, climate conditions, and soil memory effects. Diurnal variations above 40 cm and seasonal variations down to 120 cm indicate a significant impact of initial soil moisture and temperature gradients on freezing and thawing processes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 不同深度的土壤温度和湿度变化表明，冻土的热水力特性复杂，受到土壤质地、气候条件和土壤记忆效应的影响。40厘米以上的日变化和120厘米以下的季节变化表明，初始土壤湿度和温度梯度对冻结和融化过程有显著影响。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the observed variation in soil temperature and moisture at different depths in the Tibetan Plateau's frozen soil regions during data collection?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在数据收集期间，导致青藏高原冻土地区不同深度土壤温度和湿度观察到的变化的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The observed variation in soil temperature and moisture at different depths in the Tibetan Plateau's frozen soil regions is caused by the soil memory effect, where diurnal variations occur only above 40 cm, but seasonal variations are seen down to 120 cm. This is due to the different freezing and melting processes in seasonally frozen soil and permafrost soil, as well as the soil's thermohydraulic properties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原冻土地区，土壤温度和湿度在不同深度的观测变化是由土壤记忆效应引起的，日变化仅发生在40厘米以上，但季节变化可见至120厘米。这是由于季节性冻土和永久冻土中不同的冻结和融化过程，以及土壤的热水力学特性所致。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a significant challenge in understanding the thermohydraulic processes in frozen soils on the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原上，理解冻土中的热水力过程面临着重大挑战。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: There is a significant challenge in understanding the thermohydraulic processes in frozen soils on the Tibetan Plateau due to the lack of high spatiotemporal-resolution in-situ measurements, which are crucial for revealing soil thermohydraulic processes such as freezing and thawing. Additionally, existing soil products tend to underestimate sand content and overestimate clay content, raising uncertainties in thermohydraulic parameter derivation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原，理解冻土中的热水力过程面临重大挑战，因为缺乏高时空分辨率的原位测量，这对于揭示土壤的热水力过程（如冻结和融化）至关重要。此外，现有的土壤产品往往低估沙土含量并高估粘土含量，从而增加了热水力参数推导的 uncertainties。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to the degradation of permafrost soil and changes in net primary productivity on the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致青藏高原永冻土土壤退化和净初级生产力变化的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The degradation of permafrost soil and changes in net primary productivity on the Tibetan Plateau are primarily caused by warming climate conditions, which increase ground temperature, decrease seasonally frozen soil depth, and lead to the fragmentation of permafrost soil. These changes are further influenced by the increase in CO2 emissions and improved growing conditions that affect the spatial distribution of vegetation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 永久冻土的退化和青藏高原上净初级生产力的变化主要是由于气候变暖条件造成的，这导致地面温度升高、季节性冻土深度减少，并导致永久冻土的碎裂。这些变化进一步受到二氧化碳排放增加和改善生长条件的影响，从而影响植被的空间分布。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the use of in-situ measurements at high altitudes and latitudes impact the understanding of soil thermohydraulic processes and model parameterization?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在高海拔和高纬度地区使用原位测量可能会如何影响对土壤热水力过程的理解和模型参数化？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: In-situ measurements at high altitudes and latitudes are crucial for understanding soil thermohydraulic processes because they provide high spatiotemporal-resolution data that reveal freezing and thawing processes. This understanding is essential for improving model parameterizations, which currently face significant uncertainties in accurately simulating dynamic freeze-thaw processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 高海拔和高纬度地区的原位测量对于理解土壤热水力过程至关重要，因为它们提供了高时空分辨率的数据，揭示了冻结和融化过程。这种理解对于改善模型参数化至关重要，因为目前在准确模拟动态冻结-融化过程方面面临着显著的不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using both observational data and dynamic vegetation models on understanding the degradation of frozen soils and net primary productivity (NPP) in the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用观测数据和动态植被模型对理解青藏 Plateau 冻土退化和净初级生产力（NPP）的影响有哪些？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using both observational data and dynamic vegetation models allows for a comprehensive examination of frozen soil degradation and its impact on net primary productivity (NPP) over time. This combined approach helps in understanding the spatially mixed trends in NPP changes and provides insights into the future degradation of permafrost and seasonally frozen soils, thus informing potential ecosystem conservation strategies.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用观测数据和动态植被模型相结合，可以全面研究冻土退化及其对净初级生产力（NPP）随时间变化的影响。这种综合方法有助于理解NPP变化的空间混合趋势，并提供对未来永冻土和季节性冻土退化的洞察，从而为潜在的生态系统保护策略提供信息。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to investigate the spatiotemporal characteristics of soil texture and thermohydraulic processes in frozen soil on the Tibetan Plateau?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 研究青藏 Plateau 冻土中土壤质地和热水力过程的时空特征的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Investigating these characteristics is crucial for understanding the thermohydraulic properties of permafrost and seasonally frozen soils, which can improve Earth system model development and enhance the quality of soil temperature and moisture assimilation and remote sensing products.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 研究这些特征对于理解永冻土和季节性冻土的热水力学特性至关重要，这可以改善地球系统模型的发展，并提高土壤温度和湿度同化以及遥感产品的质量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to measure and average soil temperature and moisture on a daily basis in permafrost regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在永久冻土地区，测量和平均土壤温度和湿度的日常程序包括以下步骤：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Daily soil temperature and moisture measurements are obtained by averaging hourly observations over a 24-hour period using instruments like the ECH2O-EC5 and 5TM. The data collection involves multiple depths at 10, 40, 80, and 120 centimeters across 21 sites located in various river basins.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 每日土壤温度和湿度测量是通过对24小时内的每小时观测值进行平均获得的，使用的仪器包括ECH2O-EC5和5TM。数据收集涉及在10、40、80和120厘米的多个深度，覆盖21个位于不同河流流域的站点。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is soil texture analyzed in high-altitude frozen soil regions, and what are the steps to prepare soil samples for analysis?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 高海拔冻土地区的土壤质地分析是如何进行的，以及准备土壤样本进行分析的步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil texture is analyzed using the USDA soil textural triangle diagram. The procedure involves drying soil samples at room temperature, sieving them through 2-mm mesh sieves, removing organic content with 30% H2O2 solution, and using 10% HCl solution to remove carbonate. Finally, a Malvern laser particle size analyzer is used to determine the soil particle sizes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤质地通过美国农业部土壤质地三角图进行分析。该过程包括在室温下干燥土壤样品，通过2毫米网筛筛分，使用30%过氧化氢溶液去除有机物，使用10%盐酸溶液去除碳酸盐。最后，使用Malvern激光粒度分析仪确定土壤颗粒大小。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed for mapping and monitoring changes in frozen soil zones on the Tibetan Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原上，映射和监测冻土区变化所采用的方法论有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Mapping and monitoring changes in frozen soil zones involve using historical records, soil temperature thresholds, and dynamic vegetation models like the Lunds-Postdam-Jena Dynamic Global Vegetation Model (LPJ) with a spatial resolution of 0.25°. The process includes using permafrost soil maps and soil data from boreholes and soil pits, integrating them with MODIS land surface temperature data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 映射和监测冻土区的变化涉及使用历史记录、土壤温度阈值以及动态植被模型，如Lunds-Postdam-Jena动态全球植被模型（LPJ），其空间分辨率为0.25°。该过程包括使用永久冻土土壤图和来自钻孔及土壤坑的土壤数据，将其与MODIS地表温度数据集成。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of detailed soil temperature and moisture data in high-altitude regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高海拔地区如青藏高原收集详细的土壤温度和湿度数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of instruments such as ECH2O-EC5 and 5TM for soil moisture and temperature observation, as well as TR129 probes for soil temperature, enables detailed data collection in the Tibetan Plateau. Moreover, the Malvern laser particle size analyzer (Mastersizer 3000) is used for soil texture analysis.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用ECH2O-EC5和5TM等仪器进行土壤湿度和温度观测，以及TR129探头用于土壤温度测量，使得在青藏高原的详细数据收集成为可能。此外，Malvern激光粒度分析仪（Mastersizer 3000）用于土壤质地分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do specific data collection methods enhance the understanding of soil thermohydraulic processes in frozen soil regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 特定的数据收集方法如何增强对冻土地区土壤热水力过程的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Hourly measurements at various depths (10, 40, 80, and 120 cm) at multiple sites provide insights into soil thermohydraulic processes by capturing diurnal and seasonal variations, which are critical for understanding the freezing and thawing processes in frozen soil regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在多个地点对不同深度（10、40、80 和 120 厘米）进行的每小时测量提供了对土壤热水力过程的洞察，通过捕捉日变化和季节变化，这对于理解冻土地区的冻结和融化过程至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges are encountered in expanding datasets for soil moisture and temperature in remote high-altitude locations, and how can they be addressed?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在偏远高海拔地区扩展土壤湿度和温度数据集时，会遇到哪些挑战，以及如何解决这些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges include the lack of in-situ measurements and the need for more observation sites to fully represent spatial patterns. Addressing these challenges involves collecting multi-year observations at deeper depths and adding more high-resolution layers to enable robust analyses.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 挑战包括缺乏原位测量和需要更多观测站点以充分代表空间模式。解决这些挑战需要在更深的深度收集多年观测数据，并增加更多高分辨率层，以便进行可靠的分析。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in accurately capturing the thermohydraulic properties of frozen soils in high-altitude regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高海拔地区，准确捕捉冻土的热水力学特性可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Frozen soil properties and thermohydraulic processes are not fully understood due to a lack of in-situ measurements, especially in high altitudes and high latitudes. The existing soil products may underestimate or overestimate certain soil particle contents, raising uncertainty in derived thermohydraulic parameters.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 冻土性质和热水力过程尚未完全理解，主要是由于缺乏原位测量，尤其是在高海拔和高纬度地区。现有的土壤产品可能低估或高估某些土壤颗粒含量，从而增加了推导的热水力参数的不确定性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What factors could contribute to the difficulties in obtaining consistent data on soil moisture and temperature at various depths in the Tibetan Plateau?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在获取青藏高原不同深度土壤湿度和温度的一致数据时，可能会受到以下因素的影响：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Difficulties arise from the high spatiotemporal variability of soil moisture compared to soil temperature, and the complex freezing and melting processes that differ between seasonally frozen and permafrost soils. Additionally, the region's challenging environment and lack of multi-year observations at deeper depths and higher-resolution layers contribute to the data collection challenges.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 土壤湿度的时空变异性较高，相比之下，土壤温度的变异性较低，这导致了困难。此外，季节性冻土和永冻土之间复杂的冻结和融化过程也存在差异。此外，该地区的环境条件严峻，缺乏多年的深层和高分辨率层观测数据，这进一步增加了数据收集的挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be discrepancies between point-based studies and large-scale analyses of frozen soil degradation and its effects on ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么基于点的研究和大规模分析之间可能存在关于冻土退化及其对生态系统影响的差异？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Contradictory findings from point-based and large-scale studies do not help in designing effective ecosystem conservation policies. Recent studies often examine static soil types without showing dynamic changes in biomass due to permafrost soil degradation over time, leading to discrepancies in findings.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 基于点位和大规模研究的矛盾发现并未有助于设计有效的生态系统保护政策。最近的研究通常考察静态土壤类型，而没有展示由于永久冻土土壤退化而导致的生物量随时间的动态变化，从而导致研究结果的差异。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using the Lunds-Postdam-Jena Dynamic Global Vegetation Model (LPJ) in capturing the decadal changes of frozen soils and net primary productivity in the Tibetan Plateau?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您将如何评估使用伦敦-波茨坦-耶拿动态全球植被模型（LPJ）在捕捉青藏高原冻土和净初级生产力的十年变化方面的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The LPJ model, with its global application and spatial resolution set at 0.25°, offers a structured approach to simulating vegetation dynamics. Its effectiveness in the Tibetan Plateau context is underscored by its ability to capture historical and future changes in frozen soils and NPP, as evidenced by the significant findings from 1982-2014 and projections to 2100. However, challenges remain in reconciling point-based and large-scale discrepancies and refining model parameterization for dynamic soil processes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: LPJ模型以其全球应用和0.25°的空间分辨率，提供了一种结构化的方法来模拟植被动态。在青藏高原的背景下，它在捕捉冻土和净初级生产力（NPP）历史及未来变化方面的有效性得到了强调，这一点在1982年至2014年的重要发现以及对2100年的预测中得到了体现。然而，在调和基于点的数据与大规模数据之间的差异以及完善动态土壤过程的模型参数化方面仍然存在挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how researchers can accurately measure soil temperature and moisture at different depths in frozen soil regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白研究人员如何能在冻土地区准确测量不同深度的土壤温度和湿度。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Researchers use instruments like ECH2O-EC5, 5TM, and TR129 probes to measure soil temperature and moisture at various depths. Observations are conducted hourly and averaged to daily values for analysis.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 研究人员使用像ECH2O-EC5、5TM和TR129探头这样的仪器来测量不同深度的土壤温度和湿度。观察每小时进行一次，并平均为每日值以进行分析。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unclear about the challenges faced in understanding the thermohydraulic processes of frozen soils in high-altitude regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对高海拔地区冻土的热水力过程理解中面临的挑战感到困惑。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges include a lack of in-situ measurements, large uncertainties in model parameterization, and limited understanding of physical processes, especially regarding the dynamic freeze-thaw processes and soil texture variations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括缺乏原位测量、模型参数化的大量不确定性，以及对物理过程的有限理解，特别是关于动态冻融过程和土壤纹理变化的理解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't figure out how datasets of soil characteristics are compiled and verified for regions like the Tibetan Plateau.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法弄清楚像青藏高原这样的地区土壤特征数据集是如何编制和验证的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets are compiled from hourly measurements at multiple sites and include soil particle content analysis using techniques like the Malvern laser particle size analyzer. Additional data is gathered from previous studies to collectively examine soil properties.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据集是通过在多个地点进行每小时测量而编制的，包括使用马尔文激光粒度分析仪进行的土壤颗粒含量分析。还从以前的研究中收集了额外的数据，以共同研究土壤特性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection methods used for soil temperature and moisture in the Tibetan Plateau, including any instruments and techniques applied.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原，土壤温度和湿度的数据收集方法包括使用多种仪器和技术。常用的仪器包括土壤温度传感器、土壤湿度传感器和数据记录仪。这些传感器通常被埋入土壤中，以实时监测土壤的温度和湿度变化。此外，研究人员还可能使用手持式仪器进行现场测量，结合遥感技术和地理信息系统（GIS）进行数据分析和空间分布研究。通过这些方法，研究人员能够获取高精度的土壤温度和湿度数据，以支持对青藏高原生态系统的研究和管理。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection methods for soil temperature and moisture in the Tibetan Plateau involved using ECH2O-EC5 and 5TM instruments for general observations, and TR129 probes specifically for soil temperature in the Geyzi River Basin. Observations were taken hourly at depths of 10, 40, 80, and 120 cm across 21 sites, and these hourly measurements were averaged over 24 hours to obtain daily data. Soil samples were used to determine soil texture by drying, sieving, removing organic content and carbonates, and analyzing particle sizes using a Malvern laser particle size analyzer.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原，土壤温度和湿度的数据收集方法包括使用ECH2O-EC5和5TM仪器进行一般观察，以及在格尔济河流域专门使用TR129探头测量土壤温度。观察在21个地点以每小时为单位进行，深度为10、40、80和120厘米，并将这些每小时的测量值平均为24小时，以获得每日数据。土壤样本用于通过干燥、筛分、去除有机物和碳酸盐，以及使用Malvern激光粒度分析仪分析颗粒大小来确定土壤质地。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that could complement the existing soil temperature and moisture observations on the Tibetan Plateau to enhance research on frozen soil properties and processes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索潜在的数据集，这些数据集可以补充现有的青藏高原土壤温度和湿度观测，以增强对冻土特性和过程的研究。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets that could complement existing observations include historical soil temperature and moisture records, additional permafrost soil maps with high spatial resolution, and climate data such as daily temperature and precipitation from the China Meteorological Administration. These could be used to validate models and provide broader context for understanding frozen soil properties and processes in the Tibetan Plateau.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集可以补充现有的观测，包括历史土壤温度和湿度记录、具有高空间分辨率的额外永久冻土土壤图，以及来自中国气象局的每日温度和降水气候数据。这些数据可以用于验证模型，并为理解青藏高原的冻土特性和过程提供更广泛的背景。
